On the other hand, if my opponent chooses B every time, I will earn 42$ in each round where I choose R, but only 12$ when I choose B. Since there are more opportunities for me to choose R than B (48 opportunities for each player to choose R), I would expect a higher overall profit by choosing R.

Given this uncertainty about my opponent's strategy, I might try to adapt my strategy as well to maximize my overall profit.
